result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. BOBBIE L. STURN

records.addlTxt:
2:41 PM Defendant BOBBIE L. STURN appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan S Van Ells in court for BOBBIE L. STURN.  Prosecuting attorney Tucker T. Tellefson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  No resolution, set for a plea/sent date in January.  Bond Continues. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 01:45 pm.

***$500 ALREADY ON DEPOSIT***
Absolute sobriety. No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. COMPLY WITH THE CONDITIONS OF THE DRUG FREE 24/7 PROGRAM. 

AS OF 9/9/22 THIS BOND WILL REVERTED TO A $500 CASH BOND BECAUSE THE DEFENDANT WENT TO PATHWAYS TREATMENT.  

AMENDED 10/2/22 to change wording to read - Defendant shall participate in a Sober Living program managed by Pathways. If the defendant leaves, is terminated from, or completes the program the bond shall revert back to a $1,000 cash bond.
Letter to Court Requesting a Zoom Appearance for DE
Drug Monitoring Program Bond Violation Report.

***$500 ALREADY ON DEPOSIT***
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ILLEGAL CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES OR DRUG PARAPHERNALIA WITHOUT A VALID PRESCRIPTION. Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.

THIS BOND WILL REVERT TO A $500 CASH BOND ON 9/9/22 WHEN THE DEFENDANT IS TAKEN TO PATHWAYS TREATMENT.  ONCE RELEASED FROM TREATMENT BOND WILL REVERT BACK TO A $1,000 CASH BOND.

10:00 AM Defendant BOBBIE L. STURN in court.  Attorney Ryan S Van Ells in court for BOBBIE L. STURN.  Prosecuting attorney Tracy Ann Paider in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE has a bed date at Pathways tomorrow.  NG plea entered, attorney VanElls requests a plea/sent about 30 days out.  
Drug 24/7 Violation Review also -  The State requests $1,000 cash bond ($500 already on deposit).  The State doesn't object to the bond reverting back to a $500 cash bond 9/9/22 when the DE is picked up for Pathways.  Defense objects to an increase of cash bond.  The Court will set a $1,000 cash bond, that bond will revert back to $500 cash on 9/9 when picked up for Pathways.  Bond will revert back to $1,000 cash once released from treatment. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Motion for Drug Monitoring Program Violation Bond Review

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ILLEGAL CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES OR DRUG PARAPHERNALIA WITHOUT A VALID PRESCRIPTION. Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.

2:31 PM  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant BOBBIE L. STURN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ben Szilagyi appeared by video for BOBBIE L. STURN.  Given/has complaint. Waive reading. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings. Defendant doesn't qualify for the Public Defender. Record closed @ 2:41.
faxed to Sheriff's Office for handout to DE with their copy of the criminal complaint.
